Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Viable \Vi"a*ble\, a. [F., from vie life, L. vita. See {Vital}.] (Law) Capable of living; born alive and with such form and development of organs as to be capable of living; -- said of a newborn, or a prematurely born, infant. [1913 Webster]
Note: Unless he [an infant] is born viable, he acquires no rights, and can not transmit them to his heirs, and is considered as if he had never been born. --Bouvier. [1913 Webster]

viable adj 1: capable of being done with means at hand and circumstances as they are [syn: {feasible}, {executable}, {practicable}, {workable}] 2: capable of life or normal growth and development; "viable seeds"; "a viable fetus"
